text.section:
There is a Class BLX (luxury restaurant) (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license in Howard County. This license may only be issued for the use of a restaurant:
In which there is a minimum capital investment of $750,000 for restaurant facilities, exclusive of the cost of land and buildings;
The construction of which commenced on or after July 1, 1992; and
That has a minimum seating capacity of 125 persons.

Notwithstanding any provision of § 9-102(a) of this article, a Class BLX (luxury restaurant) (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license may be issued to an applicant that already holds a valid Class B (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license or a valid Class BLX (luxury restaurant) (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license.
A Class BLX (luxury restaurant) (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license may be issued to an applicant that does not hold any other liquor license.
The annual fee for a Class BLX (luxury restaurant) (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license is $2,000.00.
